@harryh Great customer service can lead to great word of mouth and brand marketing. Bake it into CAC. And don't be afraid to grow slow.
10/ Customer service is not McDonald's. The right metric is not number of people quickly served, it is the amount of satisfaction delivered.
9/ Customer service is brand, is marketing, is NPS. Don‚Äôt cut corners on it. Over invest and make it great.
8/ The @Nest hardware and software teams are blameless. I am not. Nor is @NestSupport.
7/ I think I would have thought of it earlier if 3 @NestSupport reps had not told me that they were working on a fix to my common problem.
6/ I then realized that our filter needed to be changed. Turns out this is a most common cause of furnace trouble. Nobody had suggested it.
5/ After a long wait a sr tech diagnosed the problem. He had not heard of any bug in the latest release. It was my furnace. He was right.
4/ They told me that they knew about the problems and were working on a software fix. They suggested a temp workaround to rewire my @Nest.
3/ My furnace stopped working at the time of a @Nest update.  3 reps with @NestSupport told me I had a known problem with the latest update.
2/ Turned out that there was neither a hardware nor a software problem with my @Nest. The problem was with my furnace and with @NestSupport.
1/ Quick follow-up on yesterday‚Äôs @Nest rant‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs a lesson and a mea culpa in here.
